events.name: TechLadies Bootcamp - Info Session
events.description:
TechLadies is a community for women to connect, learn and advance as programmers. Part of what we do is the highly subscribed TechLadies Bootcamp that was featured in the Straits Times.
The TechLadies Bootcamp is a 10-week program where women learn how to code by creating web applications for non-profit organizations, under the guidance of industry experts. 33% of the TechLadies Bootcamp graduates eventually found software-related jobs and internships.
The next TechLadies Bootcamp will run for 10 weeks from 24 Sep - 3 Dec 2016. This is a part-time program where you will be required to attend weekly sessions on Saturday afternoons and code on your own throughout the week. You are required to commit at least 15 hours per week in total.
There will also be 3 pre-bootcamp workshops on 6, 13, 20 Aug (you can register for them here) to prepare you for the task you'll need to complete in order to apply to the TechLadies Bootcamp. You can find more information about the TechLadies Bootcamp on our website: http://www.techladies.co/ 
Join us at this info session where we will share more about the 5 NGOs we are helping this time round, and how you can apply for the TechLadies Bootcamp. We will also hear from 3 speakers exploring the various career options you can have in the tech industry. 
This event is ideal for women who are interested in applying to the TechLadies Bootcamp, or are keen to understand more about the tech industry.

Panel Discussion Speakers
Audrey Lim, Software Engineer at E La Carte
A former lawyer in Singapore, Audrey taught herself programming after office hours after becoming fascinated by the world of computing. Beginning with front-end programming in April 2014, then Go as her first back-end language in July 2014, she loves building software and never ceases to be amazed by computing concepts as she learns along the way. She's spoken at Go conferences internationally and contributed to the Go repository. She's since transitioned to full-time software engineer and is now based in Silicon Valley.
Nithya Sivakumar, Partner Engineer at Facebook
Nithya Sivakumar is Partner Engineer at Facebook. She completed her engineering in Computer Science from India and has since then been working in the technology industry. Through her 5+ years as a software engineer, she has worked in India, UK, Europe, South East Asia and United states. At Facebook, she works closely with partners to enable millions of developers around the world in building rich and engaging social apps using Facebook Platform. She has keen interest in mobile web, HTML5 and other emerging technologies. She is passionate about art, photography and human interface design.
Olivia Storelli, Founder & CEO of Sakura Sky
With a deep passion for technology and respect for the power it can harness, Olivia Storelli founded her first company at 17 years old with nothing other than ingenuity and an insatiable drive to build and create.  Since then she has gained extensive experience across industries, countries and technologies and is highly regarded in mobile, web and enterprise communities around the globe. As Founder of the innovative digital solutions technology company Sakura Sky, Olivia’s entrepreneurial spirit has flourished, as has her extensive knowledge of machine learning, software development, product management, integration and digital project services. 
Outside of the art of technology, and the technology of art, her great loves (in no particular order) are horses, family and Italian food.

Agenda
6:30pm: Registration & Dinner
7:15pm: Opening
7:25pm: Introduction to the coaches and projects
8:00pm: TechLadies Bootcamp Q&A
8:10pm: Panel discussion – Career Options in the Tech Industry 
8:40pm: Closing
8:50pm: Mingling
9:30pm: End
Seats are limited and dinner is provided. We are unable to accept walk-ins due to building security reasons, please register your interest and do so early!

Commitment to Diversity in Tech
As we are trying to improve the gender ratio of the tech industry, these workshops are only for women and those who identify as one. We are for-women, but we are not anti-men. Men are still welcome to register!
If you have any questions, please drop Elisha an email at elisha@techladies.co.
events.location: Microsoft (Auditorium at level 21), 1 Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018989

events.name: Book Club: Algorithms on Strings – Week 1 & 2
events.description: New Course! Algorithms on Strings on Coursera   Come and learn with a group of us working through this online course together. This Week: Suffix Trees, Burrows-Wheeler Transform and Suffix Arrays (Week 1 & 2) * Finish Assignment 1: Suffix Trees Description World and internet is full of textual information. We search for information using textual queries, we read websites, books, e-mails. All those are strings from the point of view of computer science. To make sense of all that information and make search efficient, search engines use many string algorithms. Moreover, the emerging field of personalized medicine uses many search algorithms to find disease-causing mutations in the human genome. See https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-strings for more info on this course. Coursera offers a free "auditor" option and a paid option, if you want a certificate at the end. How to Participate 1. Watch the lectures and start the week's assignments.2. Find something in the week's content you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting or ask questions.4. Group discussion and friendly banter ensues! All are welcome – beginners, experts, students and professionals. Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore 437032 Doors open at 7:00, meetup starts at 7:20.Bring healthy snacks and drinks of your choice! Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS Bookclub Gitter channel: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions/bookclub <a href="https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-graphs/home/week/2"></a>
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore
